title: Really flexible and understanding workplace
description: I started working at Macy’s when I was 16. They were really flexible with my school schedule. Very formal and professional management, yet understanding. They also had many opportunities for bonuses.

title: It’s ok
description: it’s ok. people are ok. Hours are good. Managers not so much. repetitive and easy work. It gets pretty busy on weekends and holidays are pretty god awful. The store is open during ungodly hours like 8AM-11PM.

title: I used to love working at Macys
description: There is no more work life balance anymore. There is never enough help. The colleagues are wonderful but exhausted! Managment is exhausted. The new role out of hospitality is a joke.

title: Loved it
description: This was a great job! I really loved what I did in the most amazing way. This position was coveted by everyone in the store and I was so glad to be chosen

title: Good place
description: This job isn't bad at all the pay is very decent , get to be hands on, Good boss, but the only negative aspect is the hours you work not as much as a work life balance

title: I enjoyed my time at Macy’s learned what a good work environment is

title: work home balance
description: i thought that macys had one of the better work home time balance programs. the supervisors really worked hard to make sure that if you needed time off you can get it. and they had the best online scheduling system. You could pick up shifts or advertise

title: It's Retail
description: I enjoyed my time at Macy's. The pay wasn't bad for retail, and my colleagues were great. My managers were all good as well, which I didn't always find to be the case at other box retailers I worked at.

title: Amazing
description: Very good work place. Simple job. Felxible hours and somewhat good pay.

title: It’s a good start company but not a forever
description: Macys was really good place to start a career but to be honest there is not much room for growth, it’s all about the buddy - buddy system rather than skill.

title: Productive Environment with Room for Growth
description: I enjoy working in my department—we're goal-oriented and meet sales goals. However, I believe management could improve when it comes to addressing interpersonal conflicts within the team. A lack of timely mediation tends to allow a petty work culture

title: Fun environment
description: The work environment was extremely friendly and the staff was authentically helpful with answering any questions or concerns I had.  The pay was also very competitive

title: Loved it
description: Can learn alot if you want to. Some leadership are genius especially the veterans. Culture has changed and evolved over the years but I got my basics working hard with really humble, dedicated people. Macys is good American company.

title: Productive and engaging environment

title: Productive, but culture problems.
description: Working for Macy's was not the worst experience at all. I will say if you want a job where you can sit most of the time, then, pick some where else to work. The culture was not consistent with the training.

title: good
description: pretty good envirenment. As a Macy’s jewelry sales associate, I enjoy helping customers find meaningful pieces, learning about fine jewelry, and working in a stylish, team-oriented environment.

title: It was great at first, then got terrible when they started closing down stores.

title: Good job, but stressful management
description: The job itself wasn't bad, but management was breathing down our necks for credit. The people I worked with were very kind and helpful. The one big issue I had is that managers let certain people get away with things, if you sell more, you'll be a 'favorite'.
